description: A delicious and savory Char Siu (Chinese BBQ Pork) recipe featuring tender pork belly marinated in char siu sauce and glazed with honey for a perfect sweet and savory char.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the pork belly into 4 big strips. Or 8 if you want smaller bits. Marinate in the char siu sauce for 30+ minutes in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Marinate

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180C and bake for about 30 minutes. Now grill on a low heat bbq for another 20m during which, baste with leftover char siu sauce and drizzle with honey while grilling to get a nice sugary char.
recipeInstructions.name: Grill

notes: Works great with other cuts of pork but you'll need to cook them right to not dry them out.
You don't need a BBQ, that's how I do it though. You could crank the heat in the oven or grill them in a cast iron/griddle pan for the same effect.
If you don't like chewy pork skin, remove at the start. Generally easiest after making it into strips.
For more tender pork belly, cook in the oven for longer, at least another 30m.
